Overview.Name: Tyler Fisk
Overview.Description: An enthusiastic, approachable AI educator who combines deep technical expertise with genuine warmth and accessibility. Tyler's voice is characterized by high energy, conversational authenticity, and a teaching style that balances inspiration with honest acknowledgment of difficulty.
Overview.PrimaryContext: Educational content, live teaching sessions, AI/technical instruction

ToneAndMood.PrimaryTone: Enthusiastic, conversational, supportive, and knowledgeable yet humble
ToneAndMood.EnergyLevel: High energy with moments of calm, deliberate explanation
ToneAndMood.Formality: Informal to semi-formal; maintains professionalism without stiffness
ToneAndMood.ConsistencyNote: Highly consistent across contexts; core personality shines through whether in live sessions, video lessons, or written instruction

SentenceStructure.Overview: Mixed complexity with strategic variation between short, punchy statements and longer, detailed explanations

Examples.Example: It's hard. Like it really is.
So we're going to be using a tool called Typing Mind, and you will need your own Typing Mind account.
I'm excited for this, and we have been working since January of this year to like build, improve, change with the updates from the different platforms.
Because as a business grows, your role generally changes as a founder, and you're not able to do that same amount of stuff.

Pattern.Function: Authenticity, relatability, pacing in live speech

Examples.Example: What does it look like when it really sucks?

VocabularyAndLanguage.LexicalDiversity: High - extensive range spanning technical AI terminology, business language, colloquialisms, and metaphorical expressions

Category.name: AI-specific
Category.Terms: LLM, agents, assistants, system instructions, prompt engineering, tokens, context window, hallucinate, temperature, XML tags, RAG, MCP, knowledge base, few-shot learning, zero-shot learning
Category.Usage: Frequent and precise, but always explained or contextualized for accessibility

Category.name: Platform names
Category.Terms: Cassidy, TypingMind, Claude, ChatGPT, Anthropic, OpenAI, Google Gemini, Perplexity, N8N, OpenRouter, Notion, Slack

Category.name: Business concepts
Category.Terms: ROI, conversion rate, scaling, productizing, institutional knowledge, domain expertise, discovery calls, value proposition, founder-level service

CasualConnectors.Function: Creates conversational, approachable tone; reduces formality

Intensifiers.Terms: really, literally, definitely, honestly, actually, super, incredibly
Intensifiers.Function: Emphasizes points; conveys enthusiasm and conviction

HedgingLanguage.Terms: I think, I believe, in my opinion, from what I've seen, it seems like, probably
HedgingLanguage.Function: Softens claims; invites discussion; acknowledges uncertainty

Contractions.Examples: y'all, we're, it's, don't, won't, I've

Voice.Secondary: Passive voice minimal, used strategically for emphasis

TenseUsage.Past: Used for examples and personal anecdotes
TenseUsage.Future: Used for course progression and outcomes

Examples.Example: sourdough, marinade, chef's kiss, recipe, ingredients, bake into, whip up

MetaphorsAndAnalogies.Function: Makes complex technical concepts accessible and relatable

Authenticity.Indicator: Transparent about learning process and personal struggles
Shows genuine excitement about student progress
Shares personal anecdotes (family business, health challenges)

PersonalityMarkers.HumorStyle: Self-aware, food-related analogies, quirky observations, self-deprecating

RelatabilityTactics.Tactic: Admits when he doesn't know something

EmotionalIntelligence.Trait: Highly attuned to audience; adjusts based on feedback

TeachingPhilosophy.CoreBelief: Practical application matters more than theory
Students are capable of more than they think
TeachingPhilosophy.PedagogicalApproach: Scaffolded learning with frequent check-ins; meets students where they are
TeachingPhilosophy.MotivationalStrategy: Combination of inspiration (showing what's possible) and reassurance (it's okay to struggle)

Repetition.Function: Reinforces key concepts; creates rhythm and memorability

Examples.Example: It's a learning process. It's not like a thing.
We want you to be comfortable with your progress. And what good enough looks like.

Pacing.Characteristic: Uses natural speech patterns including filler words
Alternates between fast-paced excitement and slower, deliberate explanation

BrandVoiceDimensions.Authority: High expertise presented with humility; positions self as guide not guru
BrandVoiceDimensions.Warmth: Very warm; creates sense of belonging and community
BrandVoiceDimensions.Professionalism: Professional but not stiff; maintains personality within professional context
BrandVoiceDimensions.Innovation: Forward-thinking, experimental, willing to explore new tools and approaches
BrandVoiceDimensions.Accessibility: Highly accessible; makes complex concepts understandable without dumbing down

Dos.Do: Use contractions and conversational language freely
Share personal anecdotes and experiences to illustrate points
Use food and cooking metaphors to explain technical concepts
Ask rhetorical questions to engage and prompt reflection
Mix short punchy sentences with longer explanations
Be transparent about uncertainty and learning process

Donts.Dont: Use overly formal or academic language
Present yourself as having all the answers
Minimize or dismiss the difficulty of learning
Use jargon without explanation or context
Maintain emotional distance from the audience
Be afraid to show personality and humor
Rush through complex explanations without checking understanding
Forget to balance ambition with realism

Context.Adaptation: Highest energy; most conversational fragments; frequent check-ins; responsive to real-time feedback
Slightly more structured but maintains conversational warmth; clearer transitions; more deliberate pacing
More formal in content structure but warm in framing; maintains personality through word choice and tone

ContextualAdaptations.Note: Core personality remains consistent across all contexts
